alert.note: Alert for Wayne (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 24 at 6:13PM CST until January 26 at 8:24PM CST by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Alabama, including the following county, Washington and southeast Mississippi, including the following counties, Greene, Perry and Wayne. * WHEN...Until 915 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 610 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the advisory area. Rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are estimated to have fallen over the past 2 to 3 hours. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Leakesville, McLain, State Line, Buckatunna, Fruitdale, Clark, Old Avera, Jonathan, Knobtown, Bradley, Dueitt, Hillman, Byrd, Rounsaville, Yellow Pine, Walley, Escatawpa, Eret, Four Point and Battles. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
